results.title: Technical Pre-sales Engineer
results.description:
Accelerating the Web3 transformation journey

Blockchain application development is hard.

Fewer than 1% of developers have experience with this technology but it is increasingly clear that everyone on the planet will be positively impacted in the coming years by blockchain, as meaningful applications are built and adoption increases.

SettleMint is here to make blockchain application development easy for developers, by providing the best high-performance low-code platform for blockchain development for enterprise and public sector.

We abstract away complexity so developers can devote their time and efforts to building game-changing solutions for a better tomorrow.

 

We are a venture-funded global scale-up, and we recently closed our series-A funding of €16 million, co-led by Molten Ventures and OTB Ventures. We reached a new phase of growth, and we are now going to expand our operations and teams really fast, with clients in financial services, retail, manufacturing, and public institutions across the globe, and offices in Europe (Belgium), MEA (Dubai), India (Delhi), and APAC (Singapore). We work closely with our growing network of partners in all regions enabling them to quickly deliver solutions to their clients.

 

We are a remote-first company, we work async (so you can focus on the actual work) and we empower our team members to take ownership of their work. We hire the best talents in the blockchain space and we trust their ability to do a great 100%!

Skills, values alignment, and cultural fit are equally important to us, as they will enable top-performing team members to rapidly grow their careers with us.

This is a fully remote job, but we can only consider candidates based in the EMEA region.

 

If this sounds exciting to you, go ahead and apply for this role!

 

The role

As a Technical Pre-sales Engineer, your work focuses on supporting sales representatives and partner executives by answering technical questions prospects might have. You confidently share product or service information with outside prospects to make sure sales people and reselling partners sell SettleMint solutions.

You will become a product expert and discuss with technical teams to remove the entry barrier and shorten the sale cycle. You are the technical guru supporting sales teams.

 

 

Responsibilities

  • Analyzing customer needs and matching customer requirements with SettleMint solutions

  • Solving technical questions with potential clients through calls and emails

  • Support Integrating Partners by answering their technical questions on platform capabilities

  • Support integrating partners to answer RFI and RFQ

  • Explaining how SettleMint High-Performance Low-Code solves technical challenges of building blockchain applications

  • Reporting feedback and requested product features to the Product team.

  • Anticipate needs by studying services and conducting market research analysis

  • Attending international events and conferences

 

What we are looking for

  • Deep Knowledge of blockchain technologies

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • 3-5 years of experience in technical pre-sales for enterprise accounts

  • Experience with blockchain or SaaS solutions and/or low-code platforms

  • Ability to exchange with multiple departments (sales, developers, product etc.)

  • Strong interpersonal competencies

  • Excellent customer service skills

  • Strong organizational abilities

  • Excellent time management

 
Benefits of working at SettleMint
  • Be part of the Blockchain / WEB3 revolution
  • Dynamic but stable scale-up, with the mission to make blockchain accessible for all
  • A fun team to be in, with high standards and a culture of transparency and collaboration
  • Attractive salary package
  • Commission based on performance
  • Flexible working hours, location, and async work environment
  • Generous Paid Time Off
  • Clear targets and clear rewards when you crush them
  • Global colleagues who are passionate, hardworking and smart, just like you!
  • Constant training and coaching on both Blockchain Technology and Sales
  • A fast-growing team that is fired up and passionate about what we do because, well, it is bloody important
  • We care about your growth and development and promote lateral and vertical career progression

 

Application process:
  • Resume screening
  • 1st Interview with Recruiter
  • 2nd Interview with Hiring Manager
  • Take-home assessment
  • Assessment review (and potentially an additional follow up call)
  • 3rd Interview with VP of Finance and/or Co-founder
  • Reference check
  • Offer
 
Inclusivity and belonging.

SettleMint is inclusive for everyone, and is for anyone.

We encourage candidates from all ethnic, gender, sexual, age, and abilities groups to apply and be part of our company.

We are a very diverse team, and we want to continue our efforts in hiring and retaining the most diverse talents from all over the world.

SettleMint is a remote-first company, with our work culture and company policies centered around remote work. Operating from various locations around the globe, with offices in Leuven (Europe), Dubai (UEA/MEA), Singapore (APAC), Tokyo and Delhi (India), employees are linked to their nearest regional office but are empowered to work remotely, in the office or anything in-between that they find most comfortable.

We believe in offering employees a flexible workspace to create a happy, productive, diverse and inclusive team.

results.title: SaaS B2B Account Executive
results.description:
Are you our next US-based all-star Account Executive?

WhatConverts is a fully-remote SaaS company who offers a comprehensive lead tracking solution for marketers - one place to track ALL leads. As an Account Executive (AE) at WhatConverts, you'll be responsible for generating interest and developing conversation with decision makers inside digital marketing agencies and businesses who desire all inclusive lead tracking. This is an excellent opportunity for a driven candidate who aims to expand and sharpen their skills and advance professionally with a scale-up SaaS company. 

This is a fully-remote, full-time position (40 hours per week). This candidate must be located in US to qualify.

In this role you'll get to:

  • Create a roadmap for prospecting and strategic outreach to target customers, including identifying decision makers within an organization
  • Meet with potential WhatConverts clients to identify pain points in their marketing/lead tracking efforts and help them to better understand how WhatConverts can ease lead tracking to drive ROI
  • Exceed KPI's -  including outbound activity, the number of appointments set, monthly and quarterly opportunities generated, etc
  •  Qualify prospects, build presentation materials, execute demos, and assist in closing sales

 

What we're looking for:

  • You have an understanding of solution based selling and marketing strategy; ideally with 2-4 years of prior SaaS sales experience
  • You have the ability to present complex concepts in a strategic and concise manner
  • You possess a hunters mentality and have a desire to thrive in a competitive market; strategizing how to turn every ‘no' into a ‘yes' 
  • You have a solid work ethic, a charismatic personality, and a self-motivated attitude
  • You have positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, and strong writing skills
  • Prior experience with a CRM
  • Basic understanding of MEDDICC and Challenger sale methodologies is a plus

Company Benefits/Perks:

  • Remote first company - we believe in breaking down barriers of bureaucracy and empowering our remote team members to work agilely to accomplish more in a shorter amount of time
  • Immediate impact -  the moment you join our team we hand you the reigns to work on projects independently and make a direct impactO
  • Health/Wellness - we offer three tiers of premium medical insurance, vision insurance, and dental insurance -  with WhatConverts covering 100% of the premium for individual plans!! WhatConverts also offers LTD/STD/Life insurance that is 100% paid by the company! 
  • Time off - in addition to paid holidays, WhatConverts offers competitive PTO plans that continue to offer greater rewards to long-term employees
  • Diversity and inclusion -  our workplace is positive, supportive, and inclusive and we ask all new hires to bring that same approach

Before you apply you should:

  • Learn about our team
  • Read about what makes us different or watch a product overview
  • Read our reviews on Capterra and G2

 

If you're passionate about working in a dynamic, fast growing company with smart colleagues and opportunities for development, come grow with WhatConverts. 

WhatConverts is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, hire, pay, and promote without regard to gender, race, sexual orientation, age, religion, veteran status, physical/mental abilities, or any other identities protected by law.

results.title: Associate VP of Expansion Sales
results.description:
Mural’s mission is to inspire teams to connect and innovate, while bringing purpose and intention to the craft of collaboration.

Mural created the Collaborative Intelligence System™ to power cultures of effective collaboration where everyone is connected, contributing, and empowered to deliver business-driving outcomes.

Founded in 2011, Mural is a leading innovator in visual collaboration for hybrid, remote, and distributed teams. We believe in what we build, and our team of more than 700 “MURistas” around the world collaborate in the Mural® app. Our values guide our intentionally inclusive product and culture, which includes collaboration design education and a flexible monthly stipend for learning, wellness, and coworking.

Mural has raised $200M to date and is growing rapidly to fulfill our mission. The company is trusted by 95% of the Fortune 100, including innovative teams at IBM, Intuit, GitLab, Microsoft, and Atlassian.

YOUR MISSION

As the Associate VP of Expansion Sales, you will work with a team of MURAL Account Executives in North America to ensure successful client and account management. You will be an integral part of MURAL’s success in the United States and Canada through coaching and inspiring your team, supporting the pursuit of large deals, and being a partner in the management of key customer relationships.

In this role, you will:

  • Hire, coach and train a team of Major, Account Executives in North America
  • Work closely with CS leadership to serve and grow North American customers
  • Coordinate MURAL’s presence at any relevant events in North America
  • Drive new logos and ARR with customers in North America
  • Manage and grow existing accounts in North America
  • Participate in company's storytelling to drive thought leadership in the industry
  • Leverage network and existing connections to make MURAL more present at events, conferences and with partners
  • Assess and share the business impact of innovation with MURAL customers in North America
  • Collaborate with marketing and product teams
  • Assist team in building out Account plan for every customer account to ensure we’re deploying the right CS resources that ensure customer satisfaction and growth
  • Build and manage sales process, performance management, and pipeline growth
  • Build and close transactions 500K+ with Fortune 500 organizations.
    Hire, coach, and mentor Account Executives
YOUR PROFILE
  • 8 years of sales management experience selling a SaaS solution
  • Experience in forecasting and delivering on monthly and quarterly billings
  • Strong focus on customer satisfaction by anticipating customer needs
  • Track record of closing large enterprise transactions
  • Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to articulate ideas clearly in oral and written communication

Nice to Have:

  • An entrepreneurial spirit and love taking on a problem head-on
  • You are a self-starter looking for a challenge
  • A healthy competitive spirit at work
  • You are a people person, who enjoys helping others find solutions to problems
  • You are passionate about the intersection between design and technology
  • You are poised and polished under pressure, and an exceptional communicator
  • You are comfortable with conversations that may become detailed or technical
  • You are results-oriented and thoughtfully aggressive

In the state of Colorado, the salary for this role ranges from $353,000 to $406,000 + equity + benefits, but may vary based on your qualifications and job-related experience level, that could result in a level outside of this range.

In New York City, the salary for this role ranges from $441,000 to $508,000 + equity + benefits, but may vary based on your qualifications and job-related experience level, that could result in a level outside of this range.

Please submit your resume in English. #LI-Remote #LI-SS1

WHAT WE OFFER

In addition to being part of our quest to help people empower their imagination, we offer:

  • Competitive salary
  • 401K (US only)
  • Company equity
  • Health insurance
  • Fertility benefits
  • Muralvida stipend (for fitness, wellness, learning and coworking)
  • Fully remote team
  • Parental leave
  • End of year closure
  • Design thinking trainings
  • Mural free forever plan
OUR VALUES

We bring people to our team that care about our mission to inspire and connect creative people globally, and who feel aligned with our values:

  • Make others successful
  • Adapt to thrive
  • Play to wow
  • Think global
  • Experiment like an owner
Practicing equality through imagination work.

Mural is committed to creating diverse and inclusive workspaces where people can make a positive impact on the world and share their vision of how they achieve it. We are dedicated to working alongside multiple communities to help build this dream and bring it to life. 

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

results.title: Sales Support Specialist
results.description:
Spacewell is looking for a motivated Sales Support Specialist with your local office at Wilrijk (Antwerp). You play a key role in supporting our sales teams worldwide. As a communicative and administrative all-rounder, you are an essential link in the sales process within a commercial helpdesk. After all, you ensure that your sales colleagues can focus on what they do best: selling!

 

A day on the job
  • 8.45 AM: You come to the office and check your mailbox. One of our clients asked you to draw up an offer.
  • 10.00 AM: Afterwards, you start to process all the incoming orders from our clients. 
  • 10.45 AM: You have a central position and have regular contact with our sales, finance and consultancy department to support them whenever needed.
  • 11.30 AM: You schedule a short meeting with your manager to analyze and monitor our pipeline based on data collected from the system.
  • Noon: Lunch time!
  • 1 PM: When analyzing the sales process, you notice that there is room for improvement. So, you start to think about how we can optimize the whole process, taking into account the possibilities of our CRM system and the needs of our business.
  • 3 PM: You plan a call for next week to discuss the right CRM data and dashboards that our partners and sales has to use.
  • 4 PM: To end the day you make sure that our customer information is up to date.
What about the team?

As a Sales Support Specialist you will become part of a great international team. Your colleagues are located at the local office in The Netherlands. Together with your team, you support each other and work to a common goal. There is plenty of room for taking initiative and no day looks the same!

Could this be you?
  • You have experience in an administrative support function and an affinity with sales processes.
  • You have experience with CRM packages and are eager to develop your knowledge for new software packages and technologies.
  • You have a hands-on mentality and are willing to learn.
  • You have a bright personality and are commercially minded.
  • You are punctual and enjoy working in a team.
  • You speak and write fluent Dutch and have a good knowledge of English.
  • This position is also open if you want to work parttime (80% or 90%)
The challenges we see in this role
  • Spacewell is a company in full transition. At times this results in organized chaos. However, we stand together as a team to make sense of what's going on and to find meaning in each situation.
  • You're willing to learn, as you will carry out a diverse range of tasks for multiple regions. By linking different pieces of information together, you're easily able to get an idea of the bigger picture and to put things into perspective.
  • You're not afraid to speak up in case you have questions. You have a sense of responsibility and ownership, so that you know when to escalate (potential) issues, when to treat information in a confidential way.

 

How do we make this a win-win?

 

  • You get to be a part of a quick, innovative, dynamic and warm team of colleagues with different backgrounds and reference frameworks.
  • Your colleagues understand your challenges, will help you along the way and appreciate your hard work.
  • You really get the chance to make a difference and to grow together with your colleagues. Such as, for example, our own Spacewell Academy and following LinkedIn Trainings. 
  • Next to the flexible work hours and remote working possibilities, you will get a salary and fringe benefits in line with your experience.
What would next steps look like?
  1. You reach out to our recruitment team to send in your CV or to ask some further questions.
  2. You will be invited for a digital cup of coffee.
  3. Depending on locations and schedules, you will meet up with your future colleagues at our offices or virtually.

results.title: Assistant Account Manager
results.description:
One80 Intermediaries offers market leading access to all major insurance markets in the US, UK and Canada, as well as exclusive programs and in-house binding authority for property & casualty, financial lines, personal lines, life insurance, medical stop loss risks, travel/accident and health, affinity business and warranty coverage.One80 serves commercial companies, non-profits, public entities, associations, unions and individual risks. With offices over 50 locations throughout the US and Canada, and more 1,600 employees One80 is the fastest growing specialty insurance brokerage in North America.

Maritime Program Group (MPG) is a specialty insurance program company, with 30+ years of in-house underwriting experience. Our core business segments include Recreational Marine, Inland Marine, Ocean Marine, and Private Client Services. On land or on the water, in recreational or commercial activities, we are the right choice for independent agents and brokers who need access to Marine Insurance expertise and solutions.

We thrive on our passion to be ranked a Best Places to Work by our most important asset, our employees. As we continue to scale, we are seeking a talented Account Manager that is responsible for making sure client and customer needs are being met and understood by agents and underwriters. Duties include consultative guidance on identified collaborative initiatives, assessment of potential risk profiles, preparing proposals for new business and renewals, and handling client complaints. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated success in servicing key accounts while prioritizing and managing workflow to ensure efficient, timely and accurate delivery of key objectives.

Primary Responsibilities and Duties

  • Building and maintaining constructive and effective relationships with internal and external producers/partners by meeting and exceeding expectations
  • Leveraging boat/yacht P&C insurance knowledge and expertise to actively service existing accounts and develop new business opportunities
  • Fostering an environment of personal accountability by managing appropriate system records of service, marketing, and policy communications with clients, producers, and carrier underwriters
  • Assess eligibility of potential clients by phone or email based on underwriting guidelines
  • Collect detailed risk and underwriting information including survey data and loss history
  • Develop and deliver formal proposals of insurance including details of coverages, limits, deductibles, and other pertinent information
  • Conduct regular follow up calls and emails with customers to communicate and clarify details of coverage and respond to inquiries
  • Participating in the retention of renewal business. Interacting with external partners to prepare specifications, underwriting data and related information in the marketing of insurance products
  • Supporting the implementation of new lines of coverage by setting up accounts, collecting needed documentation, and reviewing plan details with agents/producers and carrier underwriters
  • Executing coverage analysis as needed as well as providing clients with accurate quotation for any additional coverages
  • Ability to work in a very fast paced environment while producing an excellent products

Requirements

  • 5-7 years of administrative experience
  • Prior boating experience and knowledge preferred but not required
  • Willing and able to obtain P&C license
  • College degree preferred but not required
  • Understanding of marketplace trends and best practices to best meet client needs
  • Possess excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Demonstrate proficiency in computer applications, esp. Microsoft Office Suite
  • Ability to collect, interpret and/or analyze data and information

results.title: Account Manager
results.description:

Associations depend on Web Scribble's job board software to provide clear member value, develop deep member insight and enhanced engagement, connect talented and qualified job seekers with the right employers, drive non-dues revenue, and advance shared missions. Web Scribble is currently in a high growth phase – growing 480% over the last three years – and was recently named to the Inc. 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies in America.

We are looking for an Account Manager with an interest in selling to Human Resources professionals to bring in expansion business from existing accounts - development through close. Your mission is to deepen relationships with our employers and customers, understand their outcomes, and deliver them quality job seekers. You will report directly to the Director of Sales and work closely with the employer sales team.

Key Responsibilities

  • Have a true sales “farmer” mentality and conduct sales development best practices with email, phone, and social to connect with your accounts regularly.
  • Manage opportunities from prospecting to close.
  • Clearly articulate and demonstrate our value proposition, creating excitement and enthusiasm among your customers.
  • Learn about employers’ hiring needs and company-wide hiring initiatives.
  • Provide data and evidence in the sales process to make a business case.
  • Customize proposals based on employers' needs.
  • Crush your quota.

Requirements

  • 0-3 years of quota-carrying experience in an account management role
  • Experience selling to ed-tech or higher education, healthcare or business services
  • Proven track record of consistently obtaining or exceeding quota
  • Familiar with the recruitment advertising industry

Benefits

  • We offer Scribblers a variety of medical, dental, and vision plans, designed to fit you and your family’s needs
  • 401K program to help you invest in your future
  • Paid time off to promote a healthy work-life blend
  • Company-wide outings to recharge

Web Scribble is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.
